summary: porcine transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV) and porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV) are the main pathogens that cause highly fatal acute diarrhea in newborn piglets. this is followed by vomiting, dehydration, and high mortality, resulting in enormous losses in the pig industry worldwide. the spike (S) glycoproteins of TGEV and PEDV possess antigen epitopes. previous reports have shown that the D antigen site in the S protein of TGEV and the core neutralizing epitope can elicit neutralizing antibodies against TGEV and PEDV infection. this suggests that these are promising candidate antigens for the development of a genetically engineered vaccine. a genetically engineered strain, rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE, was constructed using the TGEV S protein D antigen site and PEDV S protein-neutralizing antigen epitope region COE as immunogens. the immunogenicity of this strain when administered in mice was evaluated, suggesting a potential approach for the prevention of TGEV and PEDV infection. details of all plasmids used in this study are listed in Table 1. pMD18-T-6D as a template for PCR to amplify DNA fragment 6D Liu et al. 2011 [31] peGFP-N1. gene encoding eGFP was inserted into pPG-T7g10-6D-COE at SacI and KpnI sites, generating recombinant plasmid pPG-T7g10-6D-COE. then, the fusion DNA fragment 6D-COE was inserted into the corresponding sites of pPG-T7g10, generating recombinant plasmid pPG-T7g10-6D- recombinant plasmid pPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE was deleted using restriction enzyme digestion and sequencing. all recombinant plasmids were identified by restriction enzyme digestion and sequencing. pPG-T7g10-6D-COE and pPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE were generated according to the steps indicated by the arrows. gene encoding 6D was inserted into plasmid pMD18-T-6D-COE. 2 fusion DNA fragment 6D-COE obtained from pMD18-T-6D-COE by SacI and ApaI digestion. recombinant strains rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE and rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE were grown in basal MRS broth at 37 °C for 16 h. PCR was used to confirm the presence of the gene eGFP-6D-COE in the plasmid. cells were washed twice with sterile phosphate-buffered saline (PBS; pH 7.4) and lysed using a mini-BeadBeater. the same quantity of total protein in each sample was isolated by sodium dodecyl sulfate 12% polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE) the pellets were washed three times with PBS, re-suspended in 1 mL of PBS, and smeared on a microscope slide. images were viewed by laser confocal microscopy (Zeiss, Oberkochen, Germany) 5-week-old female specific pathogen-free (SPF) BALB/c mice were kept under SPF conditions for one week. a 0.1 g fecal pellet was suspended in 400 L of PBS containing 1 mmoL L1 phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (Sigma) and 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA) were then incubated at 4 °C for 16 h. after centrifugation, supernatants were stored at 20 °C until use. ly diluted in PBS-1% BSA were added to each well (1:5000) plates were incubated for an additional 1 h at 37 °C. the substrate o-phenylenediamine dihydrochloride was used for color development. the absorbance was measured at 490 nm. 100 L of splenocytes (5 107 cells mL1) was suspended in RPMI 1640 medium. cells were re-stimulated for 72 h with 1.0, 5.0 or 25 g mL1 TGEV-6D protein and PEDV-COE protein. the plates were supplemented with 10 L of 3-(4,5-dimethylthylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazoliumbromide african green monkey kidney cells (Vero cells; ATCC CCL-81) and swine testicle cells were purchased from the China Center for Culture Collection (Wuhan, China) the details of all plasmids used in this study are listed in Table 1. pPG-T7g10-6D-COE 6793 bp; Cmr gene of pPG-T7g10-6D-COE was deleted. eGFP was inserted into plasmid pMD18T-COE at SacI and MluI sites, generating plasmid pMD18T-6D-COE. recombinant plasmid pPG-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE was inserted into pPG-T7g10-6D-COE at SacI and KpnI sites. a chloramphenicol resistance (Cmr) gene selective marker in pPG-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE was deleted using restriction enzyme digestion and sequencing. a peptide of the D antigenic site of the porcine transmissible gastroenteritis virus spike (S) protein was repeated six times. the gene encoding 6D was inserted into plasmid pMD18-T-COE at SacI and MluI sites, generating plasmid pMD18-T-6D-COE. recombinant plasmid pPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE was mixed with 200 L of L. casei 393 competent cells at 4 °C for 1 min. mixture was transferred into a pre-cooled Gene Pulser (Bio-Rad, Hercules, CA, USA) disposable cuvette and subjected to a single electric pulse (1.5 V; 200 ; 25 F) with a Gene Pulser. bacterial strains rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE and rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE were grown in basal MRS broth at 37 °C for 16 h without shaking. cells were washed twice with sterile phosphate-buffered saline (PBS; pH 7.4) and lysed using a mini-beadBeater. recombinant strains were cultured in MRS medium at 37 °C for 16 h. then 1 mL of culture was collected by centrifugation at 5000 g for 5 min. pellets were washed three times with PBS, re-suspended in 1 mL of PBS, and smeared on a microscope slide. g10-eGFP-6D-COE mice were immunized once a day for 3 consecutive days and boosted twice at 2 week intervals. serum samples were collected from the immunized mice by washing with 200 L of sterile PBS (pH 7.4) and were stored at 20 °C until analysis. polystyrene microtiter plates were coated with purified TGEV/PEDV for 12 h at 4 °C, using cultured ST/Vero cells as a negative antigen control. after blocking with 5% skim milk at 37 °C for 2 h and washing three times with PBS-0.1% Tween 20 (PBST), serum and mucus samples serially diluted in PBS-1% BSA were added to each well. plates were incubated cells were incubated at 37 °C in a 5% CO2 atmosphere. the plates were examined daily for TGEV- and PEDV-specific cytopathic effects (CPE) splenocytes from three mice from each group were prepared for a lymphocyte proliferation assay as previously described. eGFP-marked recombinant Lactobacillus strain rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE was obtained and identified with colony PCR. rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE is stable for more than 50 generations. fusion protein pgsA-6D-COE of 80 kDa expressed by rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE and rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE were observed. green fluorescence could be observed by laser confocal microscopy on the surface of rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE but not on rLpPG-T7g the localization of the PgsA-eGFP-6D-COE fusion protein was detected by laser confocal microscopy. bars are 15 m for rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE and rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE. COE/rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE significantly higher (p 0.01) than those in the PBS or rLpPG-T7g10 groups. there was no statistical difference (p > 0.05) observed in the PBS or rLpPG-T7g10 groups before and after immunization. the anti-TGEV neutralizing antibody titers were 102 (1:100) and 101.933 (1:85.7) and the anti-PEDV neutralizing antibody titers were 101.967 (1:92.7) and 102.05 (1:112.2) in mice immunized with rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE and rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE. eGFP-marked recombinant Lactobacillus strain rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE was obtained and identified with colony PCR. rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE is stable for more than 50 generations. rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE; 2 rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE; 3 rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE were analyzed by a Western blot assay. the expected immunoblot bands of fusion protein pgsA-6D-COE of 80 kDa expressed by rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE were observed expression of poly--glutamate synthase A (PgsA) fusion proteins by recombinant Lactobacillus was detected by Western blot with anti-COE (core neutralizing epitope) rabbit sera (a), anti-6D mouse sera (b), and anti-eGFP (enhanced green fluorescent protein) mouse antibodies (c) anti-TGEV/PEDV-specific antibodies were detected at high levels 7 days post-immunization. levels of anti-TGEV/PEDV-specific mucosal sIgA in mice orally immunized with rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE were significantly higher (p 0.01) than those in the PBS or rLpPG-T7g10 groups. phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) and vector control groups. p 0.05, ## p 0.01 vs. rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE group. anti-TGEV neutralizing antibodies showed inhibitory activity against viral infection. rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE and rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE were significantly higher than those of spleen lymphocytes from mice in the rLpPGF-T7g10 and PBS control groups. there was no significant difference (p > 0.05) observed between the rLpPG-T7g10 and rLpPGF-T7g10 and rLpPG genetically engineered strain rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE can be used as a bivalent oral vaccine against PEDV and TGEV. rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE can be used as a bivalent oral vaccine against PEDV and TGEV via oral immunization. the level of sIgA can reflect the status of viral infection and the protective efficacy of vaccines. in the present study, anti-TGEV/PEDV sIgA antibodies could be effectively induced at high levels in the feces and vaginas of mice orally treated with rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE. eGFP-marked recombinant lactobacillus oral vaccine rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE exhibited a similar immunogenicity to the antibiotic resistance marker vaccine rLpPG-T7g10-6D-COE. the use of eGFP as a selective marker in rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE would avoid the main disadvantage of traditional plasmid an eGFP-marked recombinant lactobacillus oral vaccine, rLpPGF-T7g10-eGFP-6D-COE, was constructed in this study. further investigations are underway to evaluate the immunogenicity of this vaccine following its oral administration in piglets.
